source_sentence: 佛在迦毘羅衛國尼拘陀樹下。
translation: The Buddha was at the foot of a nyagrodha tree in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 時彼城中，有一長者，財寶無量，不可稱計，選擇族望，娉以為婦，作諸音樂，
translation: In that city, there was an elderly man of immeasurable wealth and riches who had chosen the members of his clan to be his wife and performed various music.

source_sentence: 而娛樂之。
translation: They'll be entertained by it.

source_sentence: 其婦懷妊，足滿十月，生一男兒，端政殊妙，世所希有，頭上自然，有摩尼珠。
translation: The woman was pregnant for ten months and gave birth to a boy, who was marvelously beautiful in appearance and rare in the world. He had a maṇi-pearl naturally on his head.

source_sentence: 時兒父母，見其如是，因為立字，名曰寶珠。
translation: Seeing him like this, the children's parents then established a name for him, which was Jeweled Pearl.

source_sentence: 年漸長大，將諸親友出城遊戲，至尼拘陀樹下，見佛世尊，三十二相、八十種好，
translation: As the boy grew up, he took his friends and relatives out of the city to play. At the foot of a nyagrodha tree he saw the World-honored Buddha, endowed with the thirty-two marks and eighty-eight secondary signs.

source_sentence: 光明普曜，如百千日，心懷歡喜，前禮佛足，却坐一面，聽佛說法，心開意解，
translation: The light shone everywhere like a hundred thousand suns. With joy in their hearts, they bowed at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to sit at one side. They listened to the Buddha’s discourse of doctrine; their minds were enlightened and their intellects were liberated.

source_sentence: 得須陀洹果。
translation: He'll attain the fruit of stream entry.

source_sentence: 歸辭父母，求索入道。
translation: He renounced his parents and asked to enter the Way.

source_sentence: 父母愛念，不能違逆，將詣佛所，求索出家。
translation: Their parents were fond of him and they couldn't disobey him, so they went to the Buddha and begged him to leave home.

source_sentence: 佛即告言：「善來比丘！」
translation: The Buddha then told him, Well-come monk!

source_sentence: 鬚髮自落，法服著身，便成沙門。
translation: When the hair on his beard fell off, the Dharma robes touched his body and he became a śramaṇa.

source_sentence: 精懃修習，得阿羅漢果，三明六通，具八解脫，諸天世人，所見敬仰。
translation: Having cultivated it diligently, he attained the fruit of arhatship. He possessed the three knowledges and the six supernatural powers as well as the eight liberations. Gods and goddesses saw him and revered him.

source_sentence: 著衣持鉢，入城乞食，時彼寶珠故在頭上，城中人民，怪其所以，云何比丘頭上戴珠，
translation: He put on his robes, took his bowl, and entered the city to solicit alms. At that time the precious pearl was still on his head. The people in the city wondered why it was so? Why did the bhikṣu wear a jewel on his head?

source_sentence: 而行乞食？
translation: Why do you go begging for food?

source_sentence: 競來看之。
translation: They rushed to see him.

source_sentence: 時寶珠比丘，深自慚恥，還歸所止，白言：「世尊！
translation: The monk Jeweled Pearl then became deeply ashamed, returned to his place of lodging, and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我此頭上，有此寶珠，不能使去。
translation: On top of my head, there's this precious pearl, which I can't get rid of.

source_sentence: 今者乞食，為人蚩笑。
translation: Now he begs for food and is laughed at by others.

source_sentence: 願佛世尊！
translation: May it be, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 見却此珠。」
translation: Seeing this pearl, he said.

source_sentence: 佛告比丘：「汝但語珠：『我今生分已盡，更不須汝。』
translation: The Buddha told the monk, Just say to the pearl, 'Now that my portion of birth has ended, I don't need you.'

source_sentence: 如是三說，珠自當去。」
translation: If you say these three things, the pearl will go away on its own.

source_sentence: 時寶珠比丘，受佛教勅，三遍向說，於是寶珠忽然不現。
translation: The monk Jeweled Pearl then accepted the Buddha's teaching and taught it three times, but the jeweled pearl suddenly didn't appear.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，前白佛言：「今此寶珠比丘，宿殖何福，於其生時，
translation: Seeing this, the monks said to the Buddha: O bhikṣus, what meritorious deeds did you plant in the past lifetimes of these jeweled monks who are now alive?

source_sentence: 頭戴寶珠，光踰日月，又值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: Wearing a precious pearl on our head that shines beyond the sun and moon, did we meet the Bhagavān who renounced home and attained enlightenment?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告諸比丘：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, Listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: I will explain it for you in a discriminating way.

source_sentence: 乃往過去九十一劫，波羅[木*奈]國，有佛出世，號毘婆尸，教化周訖，
translation: “ Ninety-one eons ago, in the country of Benares, a buddha named Vipaśyin appeared in the world.

source_sentence: 遷神涅槃。
translation: He'll be reborn in the spirit of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 時彼國王名槃頭末帝，收取舍利，造四寶塔，高一由旬，而供養之。
translation: The king of that country, named Padmatī, collected the relics and built a four-jeweled stūpa one yojana in height to honor them.

source_sentence: 時彼王子，入其塔中，禮拜供養，持一摩尼寶珠繫著棖頭，發願而去。
translation: The prince then entered the stūpa, paid homage and made offerings, tied a maṇi-jeweled pearl around his forehead, made a vow, and departed.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮地獄、畜生、餓鬼，天上人中，常有寶珠，
translation: Because of this merit, they won’t fall into hells, animals, or hungry ghosts for ninety-one eons. Among the gods and humans in heaven there are always jeweled gems.

source_sentence: 在其頂上，受天快樂，乃至今者，遭值於我，出家得道，故有寶珠，在其頂上。」
translation: On their head, they'll experience heavenly bliss, and even now they'll meet me, leave home, and attain enlightenment; therefore, there's a precious pearl on their head.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時王子者，今此寶珠比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, You want to know that the prince of that time was this precious pearl monk.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: When the monks heard what the Buddha taught, they rejoiced and carried it out.

translation: (30) The Condition for the Banner of generosity to the Buddha

translation: The woman became pregnant for ten months and gave birth to a boy, who was so handsome and beautifully dressed that he surpassed all the other men in appearance.

source_sentence: 初生之日，虛空中有大幡蓋，遍覆城上。
translation: On the day of his first birth, there was a great banner and canopy in the sky that covered the city.

source_sentence: 時諸人眾，因為立字，名波多迦。
translation: The people then established a word for it, which was called pratyeka.

translation: The light shone everywhere like a hundred thousand suns. With joy in their hearts, they bowed at the Buddha’s feet and withdrew to one side. Then the Buddha taught them the Dharma of the four truths.

source_sentence: 心開意解，得須陀洹果。
translation: Their minds are enlightened, and they attain the fruit of stream entry.

translation: He renounced his parents and asked to enter the Way.

translation: Having cultivated it diligently, he attained the fruit of arhatship. He possessed the three knowledges and the six supernatural powers as well as the eight liberations. Gods and goddesses saw him and revered him.

source_sentence: 時諸比丘，見是事已，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Seeing this, the monks said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今此波多迦比丘，宿殖何福，生便端政，與眾超絕；
translation: What blessedness did this bhikṣu Potaṅka cultivate in the past that he was born handsome and surpassed all the other bhikṣus of the sangha?

source_sentence: 又於空中，有大幡蓋，遍覆城上；
translation: Again, there was a great canopy in the sky that covered the entire city.

source_sentence: 復值世尊，出家得道？」
translation: Again, did you meet the Bhagavān and leave home to attain enlightenment?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸比丘：「汝等諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, Listen closely!

source_sentence: 吾當為汝分別解說。
translation: I will explain it for you in a discriminating way.

translation: It was then that a king named Padmatī collected the relics and built a four-jeweled stūpa, one yojana in height, to honor them.

source_sentence: 時有一人，施設大會，供養訖竟，作一長幡，懸著塔上，發願而去。
translation: At the time, there was a man who set up a great assembly to make offerings. After having done so, he made a long banner and hung it over the stupa. Having made this vow, he departed.

source_sentence: 緣是功德，九十一劫，不墮地獄、畜生、餓鬼，天上人中，常有幡蓋，
translation: Because of this merit, they won't fall into hell, animals, or hungry ghosts for ninety-one eons, and there will always be banners and canopies among gods and humans.

source_sentence: 覆蔭其上，受天快樂，乃至今者，遭值於我，出家得道。」
translation: They covered it up and experienced heavenly bliss, and even now they happened to meet me and left home to attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「欲知彼時作幡者，今此波多迦比丘是。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, You want to know that this is the monk Pāṭika who made the banners at the time and is now here.

source_sentence: 爾時諸比丘，聞佛所說，歡喜奉行。
translation: When the monks heard what the Buddha taught, they rejoiced and carried it out.
